suggestions.reasoning: Relaxing confluence_gap_min from 16 to 22 captures trades closer to the missed average of 26.5. Lowering confluence_score_min from 18 to 15 increases trade frequency. Adding 'low' volume requirement captures the 20.4% of missed high-volume trades that may have been filtered out. Implementing tiered take-profits (25% position at each level) addresses early exits by letting winners run while securing partial profits. The 3.5% stop-loss balances risk with the high compression average (98.2) seen in profitable setups.

Lowering confluence_gap_min from 16 to 20 and confluence_score_min from 18 to 15 should capture more of the missed trades (avg gap was 26.5). Expanding volume_requirement to include 'low' volume conditions addresses the 20.4% high volume requirement that may be too restrictive. Implementing tiered take-profit levels (25% at each level) with trailing stops should reduce early exits and capture more upside. The 2.5% stop-loss balances risk while allowing for normal volatility in the high compression environment (98.2 avg).

Increased confluence_gap_min to 24 (closer to missed trades' 26.5 average) to capture higher-quality setups. Lowered confluence_score_min to 16 to be less restrictive on entry criteria. Added 'low' volume to requirements since 20.4% high volume in missed trades suggests many good opportunities occur in normal volume conditions. Implemented tiered take-profit levels (25%, 35%, 25%, 15% position sizes) to reduce early exits while protecting gains. Set stop-loss at 2.8% to maintain favorable risk-reward ratio while accounting for crypto volatility.

Added 'low' volume to capture the 20.4% of missed trades in lower volume conditions. Implemented tiered profit-taking (25% at 1.5%, 50% at 3.0%, 25% at 5.0%) to reduce early exits while protecting gains. Tighter 2.5% stop loss to improve profit factor by cutting losses quickly while letting winners run longer.
